title: 110_hr6460
content:
The Act titled "Great Lakes Legacy Reauthorization Act of 2008" amends the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to include definitions such as 'site characterization' and 'potentially responsible party'. Site characterization involves monitoring sediment contamination as per EPA guidelines, while a potentially responsible party is an individual or entity liable under Federal or State laws. SEC. 3. REMEDIATION OF SEDIMENT CONTAMINATION IN AREAS OF CONCERN.
    Amends the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to include restoring aquatic habitat in conjunction with sediment remediation projects. Limitations on eligible projects are also revised. Amends the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to include requirements for written project agreements with non-Federal sponsors and assurance of identifying responsible parties for projects. In-kind contributions are also addressed in the amendment. The non-Federal share of project costs may include in-kind contributions from a non-Federal sponsor, which can be credited if deemed integral to the project by the Administrator. The Administrator and non-Federal sponsor may enter into an agreement for the non-Federal sponsor to carry out work to receive credit, with only work done after the agreement eligible for credit. The non-Federal share of project costs must not exceed the actual and reasonable costs of materials and services provided by the non-Federal sponsor. In-kind contributions may include planning, design, construction, and materials for project implementation. (d) Non-Federal Share.--Amends Section 118(c)(12)(E) of the Act to allow credits towards the non-Federal share of project costs to be applied to other projects within the same area of concern. Also, replaces "service" with "contribution" in the same section. (e) Site Characterization.--Section 118(c)(12)(F) of the Act is amended to require the Administrator to conduct site characterization for contaminated sediment remediation projects at Federal expense, with a limitation of one site assessment per discrete site. 

(f) Authorization of Appropriations.--Section 118(c)(12)(H) is amended to authorize additional funds for project costs beyond existing amounts authorized under the Act. Section 118(c)(12)(F) of the Act is amended to require site characterization for contaminated sediment remediation projects at Federal expense, with a limit of one assessment per site. Section 118(c)(12)(H) is also amended to authorize additional funds for project costs. Additionally, $50,000,000 is authorized annually for fiscal years 2004 through 2010, with a restriction that no more than 20% of the funds can be used for a specific purpose. Section 118(c)(13)(B) is updated to extend the Public Information Program deadline to 2010. In the Great Lakes Legacy Act of 2002, Section 106(b) is amended to authorize appropriations for research and development programs. Authorized $3,000,000 annually for fiscal years 2004 through 2010 for this section.
